summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell. It indicates ongoing legal proceedings in her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the inmate at MDC to whom discovery materials are being sent in connection with her criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: She is the Acting U.S. Attorney who signed the letter transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: AJN
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, referenced by initials in the case number.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: Silvio J. Motto Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is dated October 2, 2020, showing the case against Ghislaine Maxwell was active at that time.
Ghislaine Maxwell was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn under inmate number 02879-509.
The case is United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), indicating it was filed in 2020.
Audrey Strauss was the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time.
The document is a formal transmittal of discovery materials from prosecutors to the defense, a standard part of criminal procedure.
